title: Registration & morning Coffee
description: Get your badge, coffee, enjoy talking with tech edicts around

title: Lunch
description: Foooooooood!

title: Coffee break
description: Coffeeeeeee!

title: Morning coffee
description: Coffeeeeeee!

title: GDG DevFest Ukraine 2015 Opening
description: Official start of the conference. Greatings from the organizers, sponsors and partners.

title: Afterpaty & Networking
description: Afterpaty is a great time to have some fun and meet new people. We'll publish more information with all the details soon. Stay tuned!

title: Conference closing and contest winners announcements
description: Make sure you won't miss closing ceremony, all gifts from out sponsors and partners will find their owners during this session.

title: Material Design on Custom Views
description:
There are various widgets to create user interfaces in Android Framework. Using these widgets is a starting point but they are not enough to create awesome apps. Fortunately, alternative methods are here to rescue! I mean understanding and extending the View class.

In this presentation, I will give some Custom View examples. Some of them makes impossible things be possible and some of them increase performance.

I will also talk about how to apply Material Design in Custom Views with the support of older platform versions.

speakers.name: Said Tahsin Dane
speakers.title: Mobile Coder
speakers.bio:
GDE (Google Developer Expert) for Android. Experience with Android (since Cupcake), Google Glass, Android Wear, and (even on!) iOS. Very passionate developer who tries to live on the bleeding edge of technology. Also very interested in mobile UX.

Active member and organizer at GDG Istanbul enjoying organizing various conferences and hackathons. Also a part of GDG[X] - a GDG related open-source organization.

title: How can Android Backup break your app
description:
One of the most significant changes introduced in Android 6.0 is Android Backup - a standarized mechanism for backuping apps' data. However, backup is not a new concept on Android - we had third party solutions there for years. What can we learn from them? What should be your strategy for backuping data? Is your app ready to handle database migrations properly, and handle old, no-longer-supported SharedPreferences' keys?

Attend my talk to learn:
- How Android Backup works in general
- How old-fashioned backup tools broke my app in the past
- How to prevent such defects in Android Backup

speakers.name: Mateusz Herych
speakers.title: Software Engineer
speakers.bio: Mateusz is an Android GDE and GDG organizer. Works as Android Developer for Base CRM where he uses his android-abracadabras to make enterprise software users more productive.

title: Planning Android Screens
description: This talks is about Android UX when building new screen from scratch. We will go through some common Android screens (like Login / Sign Up / Search / etc.) and see what issues you can face, how popular apps are solving them and what are our options. At the end I will show how to plan & prototype animations with Pixate Studio.

speakers.name: Dmytro Danylyk
speakers.title: Android Developer
speakers.bio: Hello. I am finalist of Google Apps Developer Challenge 2012. Author of open source libraries 4000+ stars. When I have free time I am writing technical articles. Always trying to share my knowledge & experience on different events. Big fan of android, flat design, stackoverflow, git, Intellij IDEA. Eclipse IDE hater.

title: Power of Android Shell
description:
Android provides a set of not really well documented command line tools that are mainly used by system engineers for debugging and testing purposes. Available after entering 'adb shell', these tools can give you a lot of details about what is happening in the system and help with automation.

We'll see what is available in Android command line and
- analyze system and sample apps with 'dumpsys',
- find out how to check whether your service finishes normally and does not live forever,
- mock battery level and charger state,
- trigger account sychronization,
- change system settings without a single line of UiAutomator code.

speakers.name: Roman Mazur
speakers.title: Software Engineer
speakers.bio:
Roman has been working with Android for more than 6 years. You can find him delivering fixes and new features to a plenty of Android libraries and frameworks including support library, Robolectric, Madge, Spoon, Retrofit, and Helium.

At Stanfy he is working on a customized Android OS for in-room tablets installed at hotels by KEYPR.

title: Hijacking notification actions - lets respond to your messages!
description:
Always wanted to implement automatic answer to your text messages/FB Messenger/Telegram and didn't want to implement whole client for this?

Wanted to call some action in any notification from your app without too much permissions (or root access)?

Here we go! I will show and explain how to hijack actions from any visible notification to any other app.

speakers.name: Michał Tajchert
speakers.title: CEO
speakers.bio: Michal is Android Developer for all kinds of wearables, done programming for things such Oakley Airwave, Glass, Sony Smartwatch, and lately found his place in Android Wear development. He has contributed most of his project to the community and shared his knowledge to the community by organising many of Warsaw GDG meetings.

title: Using GoLang for building micro-service architecture in Google Cloud Platform
description: Building a good cloud-ready application is always a challenge. Especially when you decide to use micro-service architecture, where you need to take care about orchestration of all components. Google Cloud Platform can help to solve all problems you can face when creating cloud apps. Go language allows to create small isolated components that can solve only one problem, but solve it perfectly. Combination of these two, Go language and GCP, brings excellent mix that makes development of real cloud application easy as piece of cake!

speakers.name: Valentyn Shybanov
speakers.title: Software Engineer/Country Manager
speakers.bio: Valentyn focuses on Polymer and Web Components. In previous roles heâ€™s helped craft design systems for massive enterprise companies, user interfaces for console titles, and even built the occasional enchanted princess game. These days his mission is to fight for a better web and to help developers build great experiences.

title: Angular2: Reasoning behind technical decisions
description: Angular 2.0 is the next generation of platform that allows to develop complex web application with a blazing speed and simplicity. But for many developers, even those who have lot of Angular1 experience, there are still a lot of questions why Angular team decided to use TypeScript, strange templating syntax and other not very obvious decisions. During this talk we’ll try to give answers to these questions and dive little bit deeper in Angular 2.0 architecture.

speakers.name: Valentyn Shybanov
speakers.title: Software Engineer/Country Manager
speakers.bio: Valentyn focuses on Polymer and Web Components. In previous roles heâ€™s helped craft design systems for massive enterprise companies, user interfaces for console titles, and even built the occasional enchanted princess game. These days his mission is to fight for a better web and to help developers build great experiences.

title: V8 under the hood
description: What is happening inside V8 javascript engine - optimization, work, etc.

speakers.name: Dima Maleev
speakers.title: Director
speakers.bio: Dima is a developer for about 10 years, making his way from junior to technical architect and manager of complex mobile solutions. In the past .NET developer, ex-leader of "Lviv .NET User Group" and one of the organizers of the "Oh, Mobile!" community. A fan of mobile technology and javascript. Makes fun talks all around the world and plays american football:)

title: Scalable Microservices with gRPC, Kubernetes, and Containers
description:
Microservices and Containers are a great mix, but if you want to get serious about using them together then you need to start shopping for a Cluster Management and Container Orchestration Platform. It just so happens there's already an extremely popular, Open Source, Cross Cloud Platform called Kubernetes. You'll also need something to wire them together, maybe something that offers high performance RPCs, but also provides a toolset to generate services and clients in multiple languages. gRPC is a language and platform-neutral RPC framework, based on HTTP/2 and Protobuf, used to build highly performant and scalable APIs.

In this talk, we’ll demo the core concepts of gRPC and Kubernetes, and show you how to combine these two technologies to create scalable and performant microservices rooted in lessons learned from Google’s experience!

speakers.name: Mandy Waite
speakers.title: Developer Relations Engineer
speakers.bio: Based in London, UK, Mandy is a Developer Relations Engineer at Google specializing in Container and Cloud technologies and working to make the world a better place for developers building applications for the Cloud. Before Google Mandy worked at Sun Microsystems on performance and scalability of Java and JavaEE and on porting Open Source apps to OpenSolaris. In her spare time Mandy is learning Japanese and likes to play the guitar.

title: Google Cloud Platform End to End: How we built 'Cloud Spin'
description:
The Cloud is useful for a lot of cool things, well how about taking 19 smartphones and wiring them together in order to take 3D pictures of people doing crazy stuff at events? Guess what? that's exactly what we did! Our only limitation was that being Google we had to use Google Cloud Platform and it turns out that that's not much of a limitation at all.

This talk looks at how we built the backend and analyzes the design choices that we made when it comes to endpoints, messaging, storage, scalability, Docker, Firebase and process pipelines. Best of all it answers the question: How do you wire up 19 smartphones to the Cloud and use them to create 3D pictures?

speakers.name: Mandy Waite
speakers.title: Developer Relations Engineer
speakers.bio: Based in London, UK, Mandy is a Developer Relations Engineer at Google specializing in Container and Cloud technologies and working to make the world a better place for developers building applications for the Cloud. Before Google Mandy worked at Sun Microsystems on performance and scalability of Java and JavaEE and on porting Open Source apps to OpenSolaris. In her spare time Mandy is learning Japanese and likes to play the guitar.

title: New security model in Marshmallow
description:
Permissions on Android have always been an important area to consider when developing applications. Currently, users have awareness of these permissions, but no real control over them.

Android M comes with several breaking changes, related to Permissions.

In this presentation we will learn on how the new permission model introduced in Android M works, and how can we educate our users, so they can understand why are we asking for certain permission.

speakers.name: Roman Herasymenko
speakers.title: Senior Android Developer
speakers.bio: Roman is Senior Android developer at Yatlantis and a co-organizer of GDG Dnipropetrovsk. Roman is interesting in software development for cutting edge technologies and devices like Google Glass and Android Wear.

title: Mastering the NDK with Android Studio 1.3+ and the gradle-experimental plugin
description:
Android Studio is finally fully supporting the NDK so you can easily integrate C/C++ inside Android applications.

While this support is still new and experimental, it’s promising and worth already doing the final jump from other IDEs and build systems.

After a short introduction on what is the NDK, learn how to use it from Android Studio while avoiding several classic pitfalls.

speakers.name: Hallade Xavier
speakers.title: Developer Evangelist
speakers.bio: Xavier Hallade is a software engineer at Intel Software and Services Group in Paris, France, where he works on a wide range of Android frameworks, libraries and applications, helping developers to improve their support for new hardware and technologies. He's a Google Developer Expert in Android, with a focus on the Android NDK and Android TV.

title: Material Design. Custom Branding
description:
1. Material Design Magic
2. Work with colours, typography and custom branding
3. Frameworks for MD Style
4. Issues, tricks and Best cases.

speakers.name: Alex Pazhyn
speakers.title: UI designer
speakers.bio: Alex is a leading UI designer at Ciklum with more than 7 years of experience in UI design and 3 years of public speaking. His general focus of work is mobile applications and interfaces of IOT.

title: Continuous Delivery with Ease
description: Do you create builds for your client frequently? Maybe every day? That’s good, because you can get feedback early and often… unless you do that manually, pushing APKs via mail or to some app testing platform via browser. Look back at the time spent on these tedious tasks. How would you feel if you could spend less time and do even more at the same time? I will show you, how easy it is to set things up, not to spend even a minute a day to create builds for your testers. We will look at all the requirements for that and we will go as far as enabling business people to decide when to publish new version of your amazing application literally with a push of a button.

speakers.name: Maciej Górski
speakers.title: Lazy Developer
speakers.bio: Maciej is a passionate Android developer. He cares about writing clean code and less of it. He is spending time to automate things to save even more time. He also bikes a lot and would love to be able to code while doing it… using only mind controlled wearables or bikeables.

title: Let's play Dart!
description:
Dart is a language for the web by Google which is object oriented with optional types. You can use Dart to build great apps for the client-side, server-side and command line.

Come to listen to my story why I love Dart and why it makes me so much productive!

speakers.name: Jana Moudrá
speakers.title: Co-Founder
speakers.bio:
GDE (Google Developer Expert) for Dart. Jana is a passionate developer and modern web and mobile technology evangelist. She is an event organiser for GDG Prague, where she arranges events for developers including public lectures, code labs and hackathons – covering a wide range of subjects including technologies Dart or Android. She loves to help other developers and spread the knowledge about these technologies.

Jana co-founded a company called Juicymo, where she works on juicy apps and products.

title: Polymer vs other libraries
description: Most modern front-end JavaScript libraries provide support for component based development. Components help separate large applications into standalone building blocks with specified communication API. Let's compare Polymer elements with components from React, Angular.

speakers.name: Jakub Škvára
speakers.title: Frontend engineer
speakers.bio: Jakub is a member of GDG Prague and GDG ČVUT in Czech republic. He organised together with Jana Moudrá several Polymer and Dart code labs and a hackaton. He works as a frontend engineer for Shipito. Jakub is interested in modern Javascript frameworks, libraries and tools and loves clean code.

title: Bluetooth Low Energy and iBeacon development for Android
description: iBeacon is a new technology created by Apple. iBeacon uses a Bluetooth low energy signal, which Android 4.3+ devices can detect. Some fairly significant improvements were announced at Google I/O 2014 for improved BLE support in Android Lollipop. We will discuss different implementations for devices prior to 5.0, and for 5.0 and higher.  During our talk you will learn how to implement background beacon scanning, how to improve battery life (and how to choose between fast beacon detection and longer battery life). Also we'll discuss, on how to turn your android device into multiple iBeacon transmitters. Allowing a single Android device to act as multiple iBeacons opens up a huge number of interesting possibilities.

speakers.name: Kseniia Shumelchyk
speakers.title: Software developer
speakers.bio: Kseniia is working as software developer at SoftServe as well she has an experience of working on open-source project during Google Summer of Code. Kseniia is leading Women Techmakers Ukraine and GDG Dnipropetrovsk communities for 3 years. She participated in number of international conferences: GOTO Aarhus, Google I/O and GDG Leaders Summit and was a speaker at Droidcon Berlin, Women Techmakers Istanbul, GDG DevFest Ukraine and Women Techmakers Global TechTalk. This year Kseniia was selected as Anita Borg Scholar Receipient that aimed to support women with outstanding results in Computer Science. Kseniia is a big fan of innovative technologies in education and software development. She is creator of Android application for Women Techmakers Community.

title: Students & Google: how not to vanish in the crowd
description: Most students believe that getting a job at Google is some kind of 'Mission Impossible'. Fortunately, you don't need superpower for this. In her talk Anna will tell you about the opportunities for students at Google and will share some tips on how to apply, keep calm and succeed.

speakers.name: Anna Kurylo
speakers.title: Project manager
speakers.bio: Anna drives several IT communities in Kyiv. She has organized more than 30 events during last the 2 years including the biggest hackathon in Ukraine and several conferences for developers and startups. This year Anna became a Google Anita Borg Scholar in EMEA Region, being selected from more than a thousand candidates.

title: Android TV Development
description: We will discuss how to start programming for Android TV, what is “10 foot UI” and some hardware features  that Android TV developers should bear in mind.We will found out about the competitors and what is the current state of the market.

speakers.name: Alexey Rybakov
speakers.title: Senior Developer
speakers.bio:
For more than 12 years has been dedicated to game development for different mobile systems (from Palm OS, Windows CE to iOS).

In DataArt is working on development for the mobile and embedded OS from 2011.

title: Firebase Adventures - Real time platform for your apps
description:
Firebase is a powerful platform for building mobile and web applications. Use Firebase to store and sync data instantly, authenticate users, and easily deploy your web app.

Firebase Adventures is a talk about how to use Firebase in different ways to give you the ability to build extraordinary cross-platform apps.

speakers.name: Juarez Filho
speakers.title: Front End Engineer
speakers.bio:
Juarez Filho is an enthusiastic Front end Engineer with over 7 years of experience, started his career as backend developer, but with his first CSS class he devoted completely to Front End and UX.

Currently building things with love at @madewithlove and also a GDG Organizer spreading the awesome Google Technologies mainly Firebase and web related topics.

title: [Workshop] Getting started with Firebase
description: In this workshop you will learn how to use Firebase to empower your web applications using all features provided by Firebase like realtime database, authentication, hosting and much more.

speakers.name: Juarez Filho
speakers.title: Front End Engineer
speakers.bio:
Juarez Filho is an enthusiastic Front end Engineer with over 7 years of experience, started his career as backend developer, but with his first CSS class he devoted completely to Front End and UX.

Currently building things with love at @madewithlove and also a GDG Organizer spreading the awesome Google Technologies mainly Firebase and web related topics.

title: Service Worker - Native Apps Experience For The Web
description: Installing and updating apps, network interceptors and full cache management, push notifications and background updates. All these is now possible in Web apps with Service Worker! Even when the App is closed. Excited? Be the one to touch it first!

speakers.name: Viktor Zozuliak
speakers.title: Web Developer
speakers.bio: Viktor is a passionate web developer with >10 years experience. He is completely in love with making user interfaces better. Crazy about unit/e2e testing. Believes that everything is going to be in Web someday.

title: Google WebRTC on Mobile
description: WebRTC is a new milestone in the evolution of the web. This technology allows us to quickly create real-time communication applications. Altough its main target is web browsers, WebRTC is becoming a popular real time communication technology used on mobile. By using WebRTC you can develop your own peer-to-peer video chat in a short amount of time. Also, WebRTC is very flexible, you can make calls to another networks that using offer/answer model, for example SIP protocol. In this presentation you can gain in-depth insights about how to implement WebRTC on iOS and Android mobile devices for a native experience.

speakers.name: Buşra Deniz
speakers.title: Mobile Software Developer
speakers.bio:
Busra Deniz is a Software Engineer who has a keen interest in developing high-quality software by applying agile principles and methodologies, especially Scrum.

She is a Certificated Scrum Master and mobile engineer in Netas. Currently, working on an international project that provides iOS and Android SDKs those allow other programmers to develop their applications, which are capable of voice call, video call and IM using WebRTC.

Besides being co-organizer in two different community, Google Developer Group and WomenTechMakers İstanbul, she enjoys voluntarily organizing and speaking at developer events. Also, she believes in sharing knowledge and collaborating with the other people through these events, will come hand in hand with innovation and new perspectives. She always loves being part of a team and thinks that individual commitment to a team is the key to success. As a result of that she is a big fan of agile methodologies including Scrum, TDD and XP. Besides agile, she is also got excited almost every new technology in mobile platforms. And, as a software engineer, her goal is delivering software with high quality and robust architecture. In order to achieve that she highly relies on unit testing and mobile test automation.

title: Build Your Thing In a Weekend with AngularJS 2.0
description: Have you ever had and idea that you abandon after some time? You are not alone. That’s true for most of the software projects. The reasons might vary, lack of time, scope of the thing you want to build, or simply losing interest after some time. If only there was some easier way to build your thing with less hassle. Actually there is. In this talk we will discuss how to do that with AngularJS 2.0. We will go through some of the basics and talk about how it might help you implement your idea and what it has to offer.

speakers.name: Semih Yagcioglu
speakers.title: Senior Software Engineer
speakers.bio: Semih is a software developer. He likes to solve problems and get things done. He is a PhD student in Computer Science at Hacettepe University with a focus on Computer Vision and NLP and works at MITS on mobile and web.

title: [Keynote] Lean Startup with Google
description: TBD

speakers.name: Dawid Ostrowski
speakers.title: Developer Relations Program Manager
speakers.bio: Dawid is true technology enthusiast, who loves to work in areas where humans and machines meet to create amazing new products and services. He is experienced program manager with strong technical background, who is able to establish priorities for complex projects and execute across multiple organizations, according to long-term objectives. Dawid has worked in Poland, USA, Germany, Belgium and The Netherlands and truly values diversity of international working environment. His most visible characteristics are individualization (when dealing directly with people), ideation&intellection (inexhaustible source of new concepts) and strong communication (experienced trainer, community manager). He is also an activator constantly impatient for action.

title: Google Solve for X comes to Ukraine
description:
The world is not limited by IQ. We are limited by creativity and bravery. - Astro Teller

Learn about the new GDG-powered exciting Google initiative in Ukraine! It is called Solve for X and is a project of a mysterious division Google [x] Lab, (which is at the moment a separate project in the Alphabet holding). Would you like to join the global projects changing the world? - Solve for X is the answer!

Learn about the first Ukrainian experience and find out how to participate in a Moonshot Sprint in your city.

The brave and creative - we are looking for you!

speakers.name: Volodymyr Ivanov
speakers.title: Founder, Coordinator
speakers.bio: Founder and coordinator of the first Google Developer Group in Ukraine - GDG Kyiv-Center. Community manager of the Ukrainian Google developer program, a prominent member of the Ukrainian and international GDG communities, organizer of the first Ukrainian Hackathon, author and co-organizer of DevFest Ukraine 2012-14. “Community” flow moderator at DevFest Ukraine 2014.

title: Solving Dev / Test conflicts
description:
In the ideal world, developers and testers act as a single solid team with a common goal. In reality, there is a number of problems that can create a split between these leagues, and even start a tiny cold war.

We'll try to look into some tricky questions.
- How can we detect the split at the earliest stage?
- What can we do to prevent it?
- If we have already faced it, how can we heal it?

speakers.name: Daryna Chernysheva
speakers.title: Test Automation Tech Lead
speakers.bio: Daryna is working in test automation field. She has experience in testing desktop, web and mobile applications, her main area of responsibility is test framework design.

title: Material Design in Games
description:
1. Why people play the games?
2. Games in Material Design
3. Developing of character
4. Why Material Design is actual today?

speakers.name: Elena Forostovets
speakers.title: UI/UX
speakers.bio:
Elena is a UI/UX designer at Boolat Games. Over 3 years experience in game development as UI/UX and 2D artist . Winner Golden Byte 5 and ecaHack Kyiv at 2013. Elena received her bechelor’s degree from NAU, where she studied architecture and design.

Also She is indie game developer, has published Cartrans game for Android and working on few other projects.

title: How to succeed in the kids and family mobile app space
description: Learn how successful kids and family app developers understand and engage their audiences, and how you can design high-quality apps just for this group. You'll also get practical tips to help you boost your reach, retention or revenue.

speakers.name: Tatiana Protasova
speakers.title: Marketing Manager
speakers.bio:
At the moment I am passionately engaged in promoting an educational mobile game for kids.

I am also addicted to the startup ecosystem -been part of two business accelerators in two different countries- and own a startup of my own.

title: [Workshop] Let's build a new Polymer application
description: Polymer is a great tool for prototyping new applications. In this workshop, you will see, how to build nice looking front-end application using Polymer Starter Kit and predefined set of elements and components. We're going to use backend API from Dart code lab. Feel free to visit both workshops, but you can also attend Dart or Polymer workshops individually. Note: please don't forget to bring your laptop and download Polymer Starter Kit https://developers.google.com/web/tools/polymer-starter-kit/

speakers.name: Jakub Škvára
speakers.title: Frontend engineer
speakers.bio: Jakub is a member of GDG Prague and GDG ČVUT in Czech republic. He organised together with Jana Moudrá several Polymer and Dart code labs and a hackaton. He works as a frontend engineer for Shipito. Jakub is interested in modern Javascript frameworks, libraries and tools and loves clean code.

title: [Workshop] Your first server-side application in Dart
description: In this session you will explore how to write your first Dart server-side application which will be later used during the Polymer workshop. Come to this workshop to try and learn Dart, have fun and see how you can write awesome applications with it. Note: please don't forget to bring your laptop with downloaded Dart and some editor/IDE with Dart support. More info: https://www.dartlang.org/downloads/.

speakers.name: Jana Moudrá
speakers.title: Co-Founder
speakers.bio:
GDE (Google Developer Expert) for Dart. Jana is a passionate developer and modern web and mobile technology evangelist. She is an event organiser for GDG Prague, where she arranges events for developers including public lectures, code labs and hackathons – covering a wide range of subjects including technologies Dart or Android. She loves to help other developers and spread the knowledge about these technologies.

Jana co-founded a company called Juicymo, where she works on juicy apps and products.

title: Women cracking the code
description: For last several years the number of girls in IT sphere is actively increasing. In general girls in IT is not a myth, but still number of girls working as software developers, having original ideas or creating own startups is a tiny. Probably the reason is that profession of software developer requires a set of specific analytical skills, creative approach to any problems and ability to lifelong learn. During the talk we will discuss how to improve listed qualities and make a successful career in IT.

speakers.name: Kseniia Shumelchyk
speakers.title: Software developer
speakers.bio: Kseniia is working as software developer at SoftServe as well she has an experience of working on open-source project during Google Summer of Code. Kseniia is leading Women Techmakers Ukraine and GDG Dnipropetrovsk communities for 3 years. She participated in number of international conferences: GOTO Aarhus, Google I/O and GDG Leaders Summit and was a speaker at Droidcon Berlin, Women Techmakers Istanbul, GDG DevFest Ukraine and Women Techmakers Global TechTalk. This year Kseniia was selected as Anita Borg Scholar Receipient that aimed to support women with outstanding results in Computer Science. Kseniia is a big fan of innovative technologies in education and software development. She is creator of Android application for Women Techmakers Community.

title: RxJava for Android
description:
Does Android Studio support Java 8 features? And Android Tools Developer Leaders say this will not be added to Studio at least nearest year. Seems it's not a problem for developers who want to write in functional style right now!

Today we'll talk about reactive functional programming for Android. We'll look how to change your code with RxJava to write flexible, resilient, asynchronous applications despite limitations of Java 7.

We'll look at examples of async and blocking observables, filtering, mapping, math operations, retrieving observables from network calls and applying schedulers for our reactive computations. And of course, some examples of live code :)

speakers.name: Constantine Mars
speakers.title: Senior Android Developer
speakers.bio:
Constantine is a Senior Mobile Developer at DataArt, GDG Dnipropetrovs'k Organizer and Java User Group Dnipro Organizer.

He is developing apps for both Android and iOS platfroms, but prefer to talk about Android innovations and Java language features. The last areas of his interest are Reactive Functional Programming, Ubiquitous Computing (especially AndroidWear) and GoogleFit.

title: Data Binding. Next big thing?
description: What Android Data Binding is? How it will change Android development? And the main question - will it be the next big thing or just yet another framework? Lets try to find out answers to all these questions and take a closer look to Data Binding.

speakers.name: Anton Minashkin
speakers.title: Android Developer
speakers.bio: Anton is an Android developer at GlobalLogic. He has experience in both, server and mobile side development. He is a speaker at UA-Mobile, GDG Kyiv Android and several other events. Also he is co-founder of GDG Kremenchuk and Kremenchuk IT Community.

title: The Cloud Convergence: OpenStack and Kubernetes
description:
The new cloud era brings us a lot of different technologies and products that can make process of development easier.

On the one hand we have OpenStack - an Open Source product that provides you a possibility to deploy your own cloud. On the other hand - Google, with its extensive experience operating a cloud using container technology, developed the open source Kubernetes orchestration system to manage containerized applications in a clustered environment.

This presentation will show you how to manage Containers easily using Kubernetes system on the OpenStack cloud environment.

speakers.name: Ihor Dvoretskyi
speakers.title: Operation Engineer
speakers.bio:
Ihor is an Operations Engineer at Mirantis Inc - the #1 Pure Play OpenStack Company, with a huge experience working in IT companies, where he was responsible for a couple of projects, tightly bound to Cloud computing and *nix systems. Ihor is deeply interested in OpenStack cloud platform, other Cloud technologies and Open Source projects. Also, Ihor is a big fan of Google and Google products.

Apart from work, Ihor is also interested in other branches of IT technology and starts diving into Robotics.

title: How to become a Google Developer Expert
description: TBD

speakers.name: Roman Herasymenko
speakers.title: Senior Android Developer
speakers.bio: Roman is Senior Android developer at Yatlantis and a co-organizer of GDG Dnipropetrovsk. Roman is interesting in software development for cutting edge technologies and devices like Google Glass and Android Wear.

title: Tips to succeed in IT career
description:
How to prepare to the interview? What is important in the resume? How get a job in Google?

When you start a career that a questions everyone is strugling with. During the session we'll talk about best practices in creating resume, differences in applying for a job in product and outsorce companies.

title: HR sessions
description: Visit the session to learn more about insights of working for companies that support DevFest Ukraine.

title: Fireside Chat
description: In this informal session we would like to sit by the virtual fireplace and give you the possibility to ask any question to various speakers and sponsors on the fireside panel. If we are just staring at each other the moderator will put an extra woodblock on the fire by posing a taunting statement with the intention to heat up the discussion to a passionate debate. We give away great swag for people contributing to a great conversation.
